Lisa brings 16 years of experience as former Councillor and Mayor of the London Borough of Barnet in 2012. She is well known in the community as a trusting, reliable, hard-working person who understands peoples’ concerns and will not give up easy. She has an excellent reputation in speaking up and representing her residents. She was instrumental in getting the 383 Bus service for Finchley Memorial Hospital after working with TFL for 3 years. Her work as Founder and Chairman of her registered charity Dementia Club UK has also helped many people with dementia and their carers and families giving them another lifeline.

Sury is a former Barnet Councillor who represented Mill Hill Ward from 2010 to 2018 and was Deputy Mayor of Barnet for 2016 – 2017 year. In October 2017 Sury was awarded the Freedom of the City of London. Sury has been in the UK since 1962 having emigrated from India and in Barnet since 1964 and has since 1977 been residing in Mill Hill and holds a Post-Graduate Master’s Degree in Nuclear Physics from the University of London.
Sury is an ex-Civil Servant having spent some 3 1/2 decades at the Export Credits Guarantee Department until retiring in 2006 and since then devoted his time including Councillor duties to voluntary activities e.g. as Trustee of Charities, Governor at 4 local Mill Hill Schools, helping local organisations etc. Sury has a close interest in continuing to work helping residents and hopes to be able to apply his varied experience to the work of the Local Authority.
In March 2024, the Honourable Mayor of Barnet honoured Sury by presenting him with a Certificate Scroll of Recognition for ris Outstanding Service to the Barnet Community.Reform UK Barnet Branch.
